Articles.Content:
Hi KSP Community!

I've bought KSP over a year ago but let it gather dust (I was too confused with the number of parts at the beginning). Recently I decided to take another shot, and it sucked me in for good. I already did like 40+ hours in a single week and planning to do more! I found out that career mode really helps a newbie like myself focus on the basics by limiting the number of parts available.

As for my progress: successful landings (and returns) on MÃƒÂ¼n & Minmus (with a half-broken rover on the former), a space station orbiting Kerbin, a dozen satellites around those bodies, ongoing unmanned mission to Duna, and a case of rapidly evolving Kessler syndrome .

I look forward to joining the community, sharing stories and experiences.
Welcome to the forums TeMPOral! Your mission summary sounds pretty impressive for just 40 hours. So, Godspeed for your upcoming missions. See you around

Thank you! Those were 40 intensive hours and as I said, it's not my first time around - just the first time I actually started to "get" the game.

Plans for the future: more space stations, more missions, and an overarching storyline for them. And some mod development .

Welcome to the forums!

Getting to the Mun and Minmus is a great achievement; great job!

(And I wish you luck on that Duna mission!)
